title.rendered: Permanent Makeup: The Ideal Alternative to Daily, Time-Consuming Makeup

content.rendered:
Permanent makeup is the perfect solution for anyone who wants to look their best all the time, without having to spend time every day putting on makeup. It is a process in which colour is implanted into the dermal layer of the skin.

This means that your makeup will last indefinitely, and you will never have to worry about it running or smudging. This procedure can be used to enhance any facial feature, and can even be used to cover up scars or blemishes. If you are interested in learning more about permanent makeup, please keep reading!

What is Micropigmentation/ Permanent Makeup?

Micropigmentation, also known as permanent makeup, is a process in which colour is implanted into the dermal layer of the skin. This type of makeup is perfect for anyone who wants to look their best all the time, without having to spend time every day putting on makeup.

There are many benefits to permanent makeup, including the fact that it is:

– Permanent

– Convenient

– Cost-effective

– Can be used to correct imperfections

A Brief History of Permanent Makeup

The history of micro pigmentation can be traced back to ancient times. The first recorded use was in Egypt, where women would dye their eyebrows with henna to make them appear thicker and more defined.

In the 1920s, a French artist named Etienne Wilson pioneered the use of permanent eyeliner. He used a technique called micro pigmentation, which involved implanting colour into the dermal layer of the skin using a needle.

In the 1970s, another French artist named Jean-Claude le Grand began experimenting with the use of tattoos to create permanent makeup. His techniques were eventually adopted by American artists, and permanent makeup became increasingly popular throughout the 1980s and 1990s.

Today, permanent makeup is a commonly used procedure that has many benefits for both men and women.

How Long Does Each Procedure Take?

The length of time it takes for each procedure will depend on the type of procedure you are having done. For example, if you are having your eyebrows permanently made up, the process will take about 90 minutes.

However, if you are having a more extensive procedure such as lip colour or eyeliner, the process will take about two hours.

How Long Does It Last?

Permanent makeup can last for many years, but it is not permanent. The lifespan will depend on several factors, such as:

– Your age

– Your skin type

– The location of the procedure

– How well you take care of your skin

Typically, procedures will last for three to five years. After this time, you may need to have a touch-up to maintain your desired look.

Is it painful?

Generally, it is not painful, but you may feel slight discomfort during the procedure. Numbing cream is always applied before procedures to reduce or eliminate discomfort.

Are There Side Effects?

There are very few side effects, but as with any type of procedure, there is always a slight risk of infection. Procedures are safe when they are performed by a licensed and experienced Permanent Makeup Artist like the ladies we employ at Blink Aesthetic Centres.

Are permanent cosmetics permanent?

Procedures are not permanent but can last for many years. The lifespan of your procedure will depend on several factors, such as:

  • Your age

  • Your skin type

  • The location of the procedure

  • Lifestyle factors, e.g. sun exposure, etc.

How are permanent cosmetic procedures done?

Permanent makeup is essentially cosmetic tattooing. A needle deposits pigment into the dermis, the second layer of skin. The needle punctures the skin about 50 times per second.

What colours can be used?

A wide range of colours is available, and new shades are being created all the time. Your aesthetic artist will work with you to choose the perfect colour for your skin tone and desired look.

Is it the same as a tattoo?

It is similar to tattooing, but there are some important differences. Permanent makeup uses smaller needles than tattoos, and the pigment is only deposited into the upper layer of the skin. This makes it less invasive than tattoos.

Can Permanent Makeup Be Removed?

It can be removed, but the removal process is usually more difficult than the application procedure itself. If you are not happy with your Permanent Makeup Procedure, please speak to one of our aesthetic artists about your options for removal.

What’s a touch-up and when do I need one?

A touch-up is a procedure that is performed after the initial procedure has begun to fade. Permanent makeup consists of your initial appointment and your 6/8 week touchup appointment. Maintenance touch-ups are typically needed every three to five years, but this will depend on several factors, such as:

– Your age

– Your skin type

– Where you have it applied

– Lifestyle factors

What are the Different Types of Procedures?

  • Permanent Lip Color

  • Permanent Eyebrow Enhancement

  • Permanent Eyeliner

  • Areola Restoration

  • Scar Camouflage

  • Lip Neutralization

  • Scalp Micropigmentation

This can save you time and money while giving you the appearance of perfectly applied makeup every day! This is a great alternative for people who are tired of their daily makeup routine, or for those who have difficulty applying makeup.

Permanent Eyebrows

Permanent eyebrows is a permanent makeup procedure that is becoming increasingly popular. It is called powder brows, otherwise also known as ombre brows, because the pigment is applied in a way that gives a soft, graduated look. The results can last for up to three years, so it is a great option for those who want to avoid the hassle of traditional eyebrow makeup.

Do permanent eyebrows look natural?

Permanent eyebrows can look very natural when they are applied by a skilled Permanent Makeup Artist. The key to achieving natural-looking eyebrows is to choose the right color and shape for your face.

How long does the Permanent Eyebrows Procedure take?

The Permanent Eyebrows Procedure takes about two hours from start to finish.

How much is permanent eyebrows in South Africa?

Permanent eyebrows typically cost between R2 000 and R3 000 in South Africa. Please consult our pricing page for our prices.

How long do permanent eyebrow tattoos last?

A permanent eyebrow tattoo typically lasts for three to five years before it begins to fade. Touch-ups may be required every few years to maintain the desired look.

Where can I learn more about permanent eyebrows?

We have a detailed article about power brows on our website. Please click here to read the article.

Microblading

Microblading is a semi-permanent technique for enhancing the appearance of the eyebrows, in which pigment is scratched into the skin in fine, short strokes resembling hair, using a hand tool with a blade formed of tiny needles. This procedure can last up to two years, but will gradually fade over time. The result is natural-looking and fuller eyebrows.

Which is better microblading or permanent makeup?

This is a difficult question to answer as it depends on personal preferences. Permanent makeup is a more permanent solution, while microblading is less permanent and will require touch-ups every few years.

How much does microblading cost in South Africa?

Microblading typically costs between R2000 and R3000 in South Africa. Please click here to see our pricing.

More information about Microblading

To learn more about microblading, how it works, and who it’s for, please click here for an informative article.

Lip Blushing

Lip blushing is a semi-permanent tattoo that can enhance the colour and shape of your lips and give the impression of more fullness. This is done by depositing colour ink into your lips and along your lip line to improve the overall look. The colour is subtle to give natural-looking results.

How long does it last?

Lip permanent makeup typically lasts for two to three years, although it can last longer with proper care.

What is the difference between lip tattoos and lip blushing?

A lip tattoo is a permanent makeup procedure in which pigment is deposited into the lips to change the natural colour. Lip blushing is a semi-permanent procedure that can enhance the colour and shape of your lips.

Is lip blushing painful?

Lip blushing is not a painful procedure. A numbing cream is applied to the lips before the procedure to minimize any discomfort.

Can you do a permanent lip liner?

Yes, we can do permanent lip liners as part of the lip blushing procedure.

How much does lip blushing cost in South Africa?

Lip blushing typically costs between R3000 and R5000 in South Africa. Please click here to see our pricing.

Permanent Eyeliner

Permanent eyeliner is a type of permanent makeup that is applied around the top and bottom lash lines. It is a popular choice for people who want to enhance their eyes without having to worry about smudging or fading. Permanent eyeliner can last anywhere from one to three years, depending on the type of pigment and ink used.

How much is permanent eye makeup?

Permanent eye makeup typically costs between R2000 and R4000 in South Africa. Please click here to see our pricing.

What are the benefits of permanent eyeliner?

Permanent eyeliner has many benefits, including:

– It can save you time by eliminating the need to apply eyeliner every day.

– It can give you the appearance of fuller and thicker lashes.

– It can help to minimise the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles around the eyes.

– It can be used to create a variety of looks, from natural to dramatic.

How painful is getting permanent eyeliner?

Most people report only minor discomfort during the permanent eyeliner procedure. A numbing cream is typically applied to the area before the procedure to minimize any discomfort.

Of the Available Options – Permanent Makeup Is the Route to Go

Permanent makeup is a great choice for anyone who wants to save time on their makeup routine, achieve fuller and thicker lashes, or minimize the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles.

It is also a versatile option that can be tailored to suit any look, from natural to dramatic. Permanent makeup is a long-lasting solution that requires minimal upkeep, making it the ideal choice for busy people who want to look their best without having to sacrifice time or money.

Be sure to book your procedure today!
